info.author: pediapress.com
info.description:
.. -*- mode: rst; coding: utf-8 -*-

The latest version of this file can be found at:
http://code.pediapress.com/git/mwlib.zim?p=mwlib.zim;a=blob;f=README.txt

======================================================================
mwlib.zim - zim file writer 
======================================================================

Repacks mwlib zip files into zim files. After installation the writer
option 'zim' will be available in mwlib.

======================================================================
Installation
======================================================================

Download the sources, unpack and run::

  python setup.py install

Required software:

* cython
* lxml
* mwlib (http://code.pediapress.com/git/mwlib)
* pyzim (http://code.pediapress.com/git/pyzim)

pyzim requires zimlib and zimwriter - requirements for that can
be found at http://www.openzim.org/Releases

======================================================================
Test
======================================================================

The installation can be tested on the command line using mw-render.
For example:
mw-render -w zim -c :en -o test.zim Test

======================================================================
Contact/Further Information
======================================================================
For further information please visit our trac instance running at
http://code.pediapress.com
The current development version can also be found there.

======================================================================

info.summary: generate zim files from mediawiki markup

The latest version of this file can be found at: http://code.pediapress.com/git/mwlib.zim?p=mwlib.zim;a=blob;f=README.txt

mwlib.zim - zim file writer

Repacks mwlib zip files into zim files. After installation the writer option ‘zim’ will be available in mwlib.

Installation

Download the sources, unpack and run:

python setup.py install

Required software:

  • cython
  • lxml
  • mwlib (http://code.pediapress.com/git/mwlib)
  • pyzim (http://code.pediapress.com/git/pyzim)

pyzim requires zimlib and zimwriter - requirements for that can be found at http://www.openzim.org/Releases

Test

The installation can be tested on the command line using mw-render. For example: mw-render -w zim -c :en -o test.zim Test
